content:
Hi Guys...,

I've just installed the Youtube module with 1.17.0 and received an error (see below) - Brand new install - I even deleted the site and started again with just the Color module installed the once Youtube was installed I received the error.

syntax error, unexpected '$domain' (T_VARIABLE)

An issue was created https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/youtube/issues/20 which says it's a duplicate of #20... while according to the URL this is the #20...
I've done a search but can't find the original Issue...

Can someone point me to the original issue please? or help?

Many thanks

Cannot activate "YouTube Field Colorbox" submodule · Issue #20 · backdrop-contrib/youtube
When trying to activate "YouTube Field Colorbox" submodule, the system shows the following error: ParseError: syntax error, unexpected '$domain' (T_VARIABLE) in backdrop_load() (l...
Remove Poll module · Issue #20 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
sub-issue from #7

Maybe this one? https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/youtube/issues/18

Missing semicolon · Issue #18 · backdrop-contrib/youtube
ParseError: syntax error, unexpected '$domain' (T_VARIABLE) in module_load_include() (line 165 of /path/modules/youtube/modules/youtube_colorbox/youtube_colorbox.module).

BWPanda said:

Could be, but must be a different issue due to that # 18 as this one has been fixed.
But not released in a new version yet...
Sounds like a task for the bug squad, unless @jenlampton wants to cut a new release (she's a maintainer of the module).
uhoh, yep. I can both merge and release :)
Thanks @jenlampton :+1:
...you seem to have merged the change last year - just not released since.
yeah, there were a lot of things I wanted to do before the next release.... but since it's been a year I'm just going to do this bug-fix release and then work on those things for the next one :)
new version out now... d.o cross-ports done on a separate branch for the next release (not comfortable releasing without more testing)
